string.text: Are you the stalker who broke through the Brain Scorcher and lived there for half a year?
Well, one of them. And it wasn't half a year - more like just over a month. But yeah, name's Lukash. Nice to meet you.
どうだった？
Look, buddy. I know that place is interesting and all, but I'd rather not start reminiscing. What matters most is that I got out safe and sound.
Got it. Thanks anyway.
Praise the Monolith, brother.
フライトレコーダーを見つけた。
Oh, serious? Bring it here. Let's see what these bozos are planning.
俺はLeshiyを探しているのだが、彼はあんたと一緒じゃなかったのか？
He sure is. Head down to the first floor, he's at the end of it.
ありがとう。
やあ、Lukash。俺の友達があんたに会いに来たがっている。あんたは彼女のことを知っていると思う。

Ah, yes. Come on in! Help yourself to some grass - you might need it for the trip ahead. You made the right choice coming here, you two. Loki's job became a lot harder after the Monolith got a second wind. The medicine you'll bring him will help save many decent people.
Apparently Hip has never been past the Barrier before. Is this true?

Yes. Can't blame her. After you watch some of your friends get zombified before your eyes, makes sense you'd want to get the hell away from the place it happened. Between that, and having to fight Duty...eh. But she seems resolved to make the trip now. The two of you will be going to Yanov station in Jupiter. Drop these meds off with Loki once you arrive.
Alright. The sooner we go, the better.
Hang on Lukash. Just need a minute to get everything together.
I'd like to know more about Freedom's way of life.
The boys like to celebrate Bob Marley's birthday whenever it comes 'round. Gotta make sure we're all stocked up on ham before it comes around again.

The military developed a bulletproof vest with healing capabilities. Naturally, we had to get hold of one. Once we did, we tried adapting it into our own suits. Didn't really go anywhere, so we made the data publicly available in case anyone else wanted to try.
No one likes walking through the so-called Bloodsucker Village nearby. Sure, it looks empty, but no one wants to be the guy who makes sure, you know?

Although we're pretty chilled, we can't abide a snitch. Caught one of my men selling our secrets to the damn Mercs! Now both the snitch and his contact have been buried in stitches, if you catch my drift.

You may be wondering why we despise Duty. Ideological differences aside, they like shooting people who don't meet their standards, as well as robbing people who carry so-called 'contraband' past their checkpoints. They're crooks pretending to bring order.
We have an understanding with the Mercs - they don't try to spy on us or try to bribe our members, and we don't leave them in shallow graves. It's a system that's worked pretty well so far.
We try fight against the Military as often as possible. If they take over, they'd turn this paradise into a bloody zoo.
We happily accept anyone who recognizes that the Zone is a place where laws don't apply, where you can live right and live freely under your own morals.

We're easily the most jolly bunch in the Zone. And the Zone's a miracle, really. Anomalies, artefacts, even mutants, all of it. Well, most of them, anyway. Anyhow, people should be able to come here and enjoy its wonders. Open access for everyone, 24/7. Sharing is caring, right? While we're at it, why not have some fun? No code, no discipline, but loyal companions you can count on when things go south. Wanna drink some beer with friends? Go ahead. Beat the crap out of Monolith freaks? Of course. Kick some Duty ass? Knock yourself out! Plenty of opportunities for a great experience.
Maybe another time, man? I've got some boys who want to see me soon.
やあ、ここで何やってるんだ？
Nothing much. I'm Leshiy, nice to meet you. I'm the local guide and scout.
And how's the local intelligence? I presume you've visited many places.

Indeed. I've even been in an anomaly. That was when I was still a mercenary... entered a spatial bubble with my squad. It's a long story. Anyway, I offer guides to the Cordon, Yantar and Yanov station in Jupiter. Forty-five hundred, five thousand, and six thousand rubles respectively.
覚えておこう。
連れて行ってほしいところがある。
もちろんだ。どこに行きたい？
Yanovまで %c[d_orange][6000 RU]
Need the money first, pal.
ほらよ。
Cordonまで。 %c[d_orange][4500 RU]
金は持っているのか？
ほら受け取れ。
Yantarまで。 %c[d_orange][5000 RU]
金は持ってきたか?
もちろんだ。ほらよ。
忘れた。
気が変わった。
